additional_verses.text:
Let me go where none are weary,
Where is raised no note of woe ;
Let me go and bethink me merely
Of the bliss I'm going to ;
Let me go, for bliss eternal
Lures my soul away, away,
And the voice a song triumphant
Thrills my heart, I cannot stay.
Cho.—Let me go, &c.

Let me go, why should I tarry ?
What has earth to bind me here ?
Not what each does so clearly
Others will cling to so dear ;
Let me go, for hopes most cherished,
Blasted round me often lie ;
Oh ! The grief too brightest flowers,
But to wither and to die.
Cho.—Let me go, &c.
